s.text: Commercial and critical success for the gay housecleaner-turned-humorist's collection of essays--seventh on this week's New York Times best-seller list.

[but] is also working principally in bite-size slices of sound, sentiment and humor."
Newsday 's Linda Winer says Wasserstein has matured into "her own bright, eloquent and great-hearted version of George Bernard Shaw."

Most critics are happy to reconsider the maligned "blue period," which is now deemed "Picasso at his most accessible" by the Wall Street Journal 's Deborah Solomon ("you don't need to know the first thing about line or form to be deeply moved by them").

Most critics are happy to reconsider the maligned "blue period," which is now deemed "Picasso at his most accessible" by the Wall Street Journal 's Deborah Solomon ("you don't need to know the first thing about line or form to be deeply moved by them").
In the New York Times Book Review , Nicholas Jenkins says the poetry "articulates with dreamlike clarity not the perfections of European and American culture, but its chronic anguish ...
Book -- When the Sons of Heaven Meet the Daughters of the Earth , by Fernanda Eberstadt;
Book -- The Big Picture , by Douglas Kennedy.
